DataElement.preferredName: MUSE 6 Agreement Remembering to Take All Medicine was Easy Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how easy it was to remember to take all medicine, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medication Understanding and Use Self-Efficacy Scale Agreement Remembering to Take All Medicine was Easy Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tool designed to measure an individual's belief in their ability to understand instructions, use prescription medications, and adhere to medication regimens._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._A response indicating that an individual feels or felt that remembering to take all their medicines was easy._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Medication Understanding and Use Self-Efficacy Scale
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tool designed to measure an individual's belief in their ability to understand instructions, use prescription medications, and adhere to medication regimens.

Concepts.definition: The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.

A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: MUSE: Medication Understanding and Use Self-Efficacy Scale, Kenzie A. et al., Patient Education and Counseling 80, 2010; 372-376

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes with ranges from 1 (Strongly Disagree) to 4 (Strongly Agree) on a 4-point Likert scale.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is in slight agreement with something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is in slight agreement with something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is in slight disagreement with something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is in slight disagreement with something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Medication Understanding and Use Self-Efficacy Scale
It is easy to remember to tak
ReferenceDocuments.description: It is easy to remember to take all my medicines.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

DataElement.origin: MUSE: Medication Understanding and Use Self-Efficacy Scale, Kenzie A. et al., Patient Education and Counseling 80, 2010; 372-376
